review: A powerful punch of awesome tech in a small and well thought out design. Fire Stick make any TV smarter and enables you to maximize your TV's entertainment potential. Far superior to Google's Chrome Cast and a more economical alternative to Apple TV.
author: T. Arnold

review: I bought this at a kiosk right before Christmas. At first we had issues with it not registering. We ended up calling customer service and they fixed it. So it worked, slowly. Didn't use it during the week (I binge watch on the weekends) and it stopped working. So I removed it and reregisted it and ended up calling customer service again and they couldn't fix it. So I ended up calling the kiosk and they took it back even though I threw out the box. This new one works flawlessly with the help of the Almond range extender that I bought. Now I'm completely satisfied. Awesome product!

review: Anyone else having remote and lag issues? Before you say it's my Internet, it's not. I've checked. The remote super lags, sometimes it doesn't even work. Everything I play (netflix, hulu, etc) has those buffeting type lags. It worked fine the first few days, smooth, no problem with the controller. But now not so much.
author: Jessica Saefong

review: Fire TV Stick is nice alternative to Roku and a great addition to my Samsung plasma. Great user interface. Much less clunky than a Roku or integrated SmartTV interface. Loads quickly and keeps good connection with WiFi. Hulu Plus app could use some updating to make it less buggy. Use with surround sound receiver is problematic at times as sound takes a second or two to initially play from stick, through speakers. Overall a great device though. I'm considering getting a second one. Will throw out my old Xbox 360 as soon as Amazon adds HBOGO app to TV Stick.
author: on the air
